title: Anthropromorphic Soft Robotics Hand
description: University Biomechtronics Project that explored the design and development of a print in place robotics fingers.
what: Design and construct a robotic hand that is capable of picking up a variety of items
Additional focus on Anthropromorphic design and soft finger 3D printing
how: Use of TPU filament for the phalanges and cast silicone for the contact surfaces.
Models all designed in Autodesk Inventor.
Dyneema cord tendons in a whiffle tree configuration controlled by a single servo motor to achieve underactued contraction
result: The hand was able to picked up all items, whilst being lightweight with a high degree of dexterity.
